block.p: Apparently, the Bronze Age has an expansion contract. Cosmetics companies are making bronzing-powder compacts the size of salad plates, guaranteed not to leave a square inch of skin unburnished. Color-hungry customers can choose from supersize compacts by T. LeClerc ($55, at Barneys New York), NYX ($16, at Duane Reade stores), Smashbox ($54 at Sephora) and Guerlain ($65, available in late July at Saks Fifth Avenue; call 212-940-2660 to preorder). Estée Lauder's limited-edition azurée soleil compact in blue enamel with gold trim hearkens back to 70s Côte d'Azur glamour in an extra big way ($75 at esteelauder.com). Brush the bronzer on the face, collarbone, even knees and shins for a hint of hue -- click the compacts closed and they could practically double as luxe Frisbees at the season's first barbecues.
